page.title: 05GAME FARM, BERRINGTON
page.content: {The Game Farm, Berrington}began in 1977 on part of the Eaton Mascott Estate. It now has 6 employees, 4 of whom work full time. {Eggs}are laid by{pheasants, ducks}and {partridge}from March till June. These are collected each day and are then {incubated.}3000-5000 pheasant eggs, 100-600 duck eggs and partridge eggs by the hundred are incubated weekly. {The}day old chicks are sold to farms where the gamekeepers continue their rearing until releasing them into the wild prior to shooting by groups or individuals. Many of these people pay for this sport. On{Birch Hill}and around some of the {pools}near Berrington Sold Shoots attract European and Arab sportsmen.
